fruitninja.model

Class SlashTrail

  • java.lang.Object
    • fruitninja.model.SlashTrail

  • public class SlashTrail
extends java.lang.Object
    The SlashTrail class holds the begin and end positions of a slash movement. It also provides a way to remember/check if the player slashed an object.
    Since:
    2015-11-17
    Version:
    1.0

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      SlashTrail()
      Sets the default values for the SlashTrail.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods

      Returns if the GameObject was slashed.
      void setEndPosition(int endX, int endY)
      Sets the end x and y positions for the SlashTrail object.
      void setSlashed(boolean slashed)
      Sets if the GameObject was slashed.
      void setStartPosition(int startX, int startY)
      Sets the starting x and y positions for the SlashTrail object.

    • Constructor Detail

      • SlashTrail

        public SlashTrail()

    • Method Detail

      • setStartPosition

        public void setStartPosition(int startX,
                             int startY)
        Sets the starting x and y positions for the SlashTrail object.
        Parameters:
        startX - The starting x position of the Slashtrail object.
        startY - The starting y position of the Slashtrail object.

      • setEndPosition

        public void setEndPosition(int endX,
                           int endY)
        Sets the end x and y positions for the SlashTrail object.
        Parameters:
        endX - The end x position of the Slashtrail object.
        endY - The end y position of the Slashtrail object.

      • isSlashed

        public boolean isSlashed()
        Returns if the GameObject was slashed. If the starting position equals the end position (trail length of 0) the return will always be false.
        Returns:
        Slashed state of the GameObject.

      • setSlashed

        public void setSlashed(boolean slashed)
        Sets if the GameObject was slashed. This method is used to remember whether the GameObject has been slashed.
        Parameters:
        slashed - Slashed state of the GameObject.
